data.title: Grab & Go or Just Relax Right There
data.text: We probably wouldn't have found this little gem if it hadn't been reviewed by "Los Angeles" magazine as having the best poke around.  It is conveniently located on PCH near Beryl but somewhat obscured by the shade trees. We enjoy poke and this did not disappoint\! The server was very friendly and helpful, as I don't like my poke really spicy so I opted for the Cali -- very good with avocado mixed in.  We also got the regular which had more of a kick yet very good.  Add in seaweed salad, endamame, rice and good to enjoy on the beach or on their sidewalk cafe.  It was very fresh and delicious so we will be returning!!

data.title: My Taste Buds are Tinglin'
data.text: I just got done with a good hike on the chip bark trail through Hermosa Beach and into Manhattan Beach with my dog and a friend so I stopped at Jus' Poke for the first time on my way home.  It's such a teeny place but so good!  The guys at the counter were super friendly and offered a taste of the spicy poke which they recommended as a first-timer.  Wow!  Spicy but not too much and perfect accompanied by the cucumber salad and brown rice.  For $10 the portion size was big and I thought I'd have some leftover, but nope--glug down the hatch!

data.title: So delicious!!
data.text: I had my first poke experience here, and it did not disappoint! I got a mix of the original and spicy poke with edamame beans and brown rice. It was soooo good! The fish was so fresh, and the seasoning brought out the flavors perfectly. Even the 'normal' size is a generous serving, which left me feeling full but light. I can't wait to return!

data.title: Worth jus poke(n) in for lunch!
data.text: My husband read about this place. Then a friend mentioned it. We are from out of town & staying fairly close, we decided to make "Jus' Poke" a destination.  Boy were we pleased!  Order at the counter: choose the marinade/flavor, bowl or just poke (fish)..... Comes with a side & rice. Super fast. And FRESH.  Oh, and the price is right too!!!  They are friendly. Small space to eat indoors or choose to sit outside.  Can do takeout..... Hands down best lunch we've had!!!

data.title: Love the Poke;  Good, quick, and convenient
data.text:
Jus' Poke in Redondo is great!  They offer different kinds of poke to try - regular, spicy, and one with a shoyu sauce.  The large size is a generous portion.  You get two scoops of rice, a large portion of poke (you can choose up to two 'flavors'), and then some accompaniments on top (sesame seems, seaweed salt (or something like that), or another option).  They also have a "craft soda" selection.  Nothing from a coke machine, bottled sodas that go great with the poke.  
I highly recommend if you are in the South Bay.  Nice people that work there too.

data.title: Fresh poke
data.text: We had the original poke with avacado and a side of marinated cucumber and a scoop of white rice. The poke was very fresh and tasty. For drinks they offer sodas, teas, juice and water. Too bad they don't sell beer or wine.

data.title: Jus' Poke is FRESH FRESH FRESH !!!
data.text:
Went for the half pound bowl. $10, Extremely fresh fish, texture was awesome, flavor was awesome!
If you like fresh raw tuna, this place will not dissapoint.
Wish I had time to try some of their sides. 
Hopefully I can on the next visit, cause im definetly coming back!

Thank You for the Delicious Meal!

data.title: Always great!
data.text: You will love it!  Several varieties of poke.  You can't go wrong.  Fish is always fresh.  If you are at Redondo Pier, it is worth the walk - much better than anything on the pier.

data.title: Best poke I've had
data.text: Delicious food, and mochi ice cream.  There are a few tables outside, and also indoor seating.  You order from the counter and pay there.  I got a small poke bowl, that included my choice of poke, brown or white rice, and one side.  I selected the spicy pickled cucumbers, and they were great.  The small was about $9.50 (total bill $10.37).  The large was about $14.  The small was plenty large enough for me.  I wish this were closer to my home, but I would definitely eat there again when I am in the area.  I love poke, and this was the best of any I'd ever eaten.  They even have tofu poke, if you go there with a vegetarian.

data.title: Fresh & Delish!
data.text: I have been wanting to try this spot for a long time and finally made the pit stop today.  I grabbed some of the Wasabi and some of the Spicey Poke.  It honestly reminded me of the great spots in Hawaii. Super fresh and extremely tasty.  Will definitely be back! Thanks!

data.title: Jus' Poke Rocks!!
data.text: This place absolutely rocks.  Super fresh fish, super tender, and killer side dishes.  Try the seaweed salad (doesn't taste like seaweed).  Service is fast and friendly.   Poke here is better than in Hawaii.  Try it!!!

data.title: Dinner
data.text: I found this place by walking by.  It was the first time I had a Poke before and server was more than happy to help me out.  She let me try all the types of tuna and gave me a few recommendations.  Food was great and fresh and different.  Loved the food and staff could not have been better.

data.title: Pretty good!
data.text: We wanted to try this out because it came highly recommended by friends who lived in the area. It's also on the Top 1 highly reviewed restaurant in the area by Yelpers. So we were sold. I had the Wasabi Poke and my husband had the Original. Both were pretty good. The Tuna and the seaweed salad were super fresh and the brown rice was well cooked. Definitely a must-try when you are in the area!

data.title: Kinda.....meh....
data.text:
Not bad. Not great. 

The poke/fish is fresh, and quite tasty. The rice, rather clumpy and congealed - perhaps overcooked or dated. Sides, hit or miss. Cucumbers are a bit soft but the rest, decent. 

On the whole, again - not bad - but for the price, the utensils and setting, I expected better.

data.title: The Better Fast Food
data.text:
Great poke and they have several variations. Quality Ahi. Fast service. 
There is nothing better than grabbing poke to go, some chopsticks and then stroll down the beach for a great view and some fine poke dining. Repeat.

data.title: Just Poke ...and I love it
data.text: Restaurant is a bit hard to find, small parking lot and if you don't pay attention, you just drive by. Nothing fancy inside, but clean and light. Some outdoor seating. But all this is not that important as they do "jus Poke". Flavors are great, portions are good, fish is fresh, seaweed salad delicious etc. Try a variety of Poke, they are all great.

data.title: Ono
data.text: I often drove by Jus Poke while on business in the South Bay.  Wish I would have stopped on previous trips.  The Poke is fresh and delicious (Ono in Hawaiian). I had the spicy and wasabi.  Portions was large, seaweed salad was great and good portion of rice. Can't wait for my next business trip.

data.title: Must go to Jus Poke
data.text: We drove by earlier in the day and saw people lined up to get Poke (say po-kay). Didn’t know what it was and drove on. Had a chance the next day and stopped in to see what the fuss was about. Boy am I glad we did. Poke is Ahi-Tuna marinated raw with different ingredients. We had the Spicy Poke and Shoyu Poke. Mine with Spicy edamame and hers with seaweed salad. The stuff is addicting! So good. We had to try the Wasabi Poke when we were done. Delicious. Go. Too bad they are not on the east coast.

user_location.name: Staten Island, New York, United States

data.title: Great or the only Poke place in the beach area
data.text: If you like Ahi Poke from Hawaii, you would want to try this place. It's not a "restaurant", but good for a quick bites.

data.title: If you LIKE Poke, you'll LOVE Jus' Poke!
data.text: If you like Poke, you'll love Jus' Poke! Several different flavor to choose from. Try two in the regular size dinner. Such a deal!!! The people who work there are real nice and conversational. Authentic!
